Package gov.sandia.geotess

Class Profile

java.lang.Object
gov.sandia.geotess.Profile
Direct Known Subclasses:
ProfileConstant, ProfileEmpty, ProfileNPoint, ProfileSurface, ProfileSurfaceEmpty, ProfileThin
public abstract class Profile extends Object
A Profile defines the distribution of Data along a radial profile through a single layer in a model. While there is a Profile object for each vertex in the 2D grid, and for each layer in the model, a Profile object does not have any information about the geographic position where it is located, nor about which layer it spans. A Profile does manage a list of Data objects and radius values that together define the radial distribution along the Profile. Radii are always listed in monotonically increasing order.

Profile is abstract with five derived classes:

  • ProfileEmpty : two radii and no Data
  • ProfileThin : one radius and one Data
  • ProfileConstant : two radii and one Data
  • ProfileNPoint : two or more radii and an equal number of Data
  • ProfileSurface : no radii and one Data

There is no public constructor. Call the constructor of one of the derived classes to obtain an instance.

    • isNaN

      public abstract boolean isNaN​(int nodeIndex, int attributeIndex)
      Return true if the specified Data value is NaN. For doubles and floats, this means not NaN. For bytes, shorts, ints and longs, always returns false since there is no value that is NaN
      Parameters:
      nodeIndex -
      attributeIndex -
      Returns:
      true if the specified Data value is valid.

    • getValue

      public double getValue​(InterpolatorType interpType, int attributeIndex, double radius, boolean allowRadiusOutOfRange)
      Retrieve the value of the specified attribute interpolated at the specified radius. If radius is less than radiusBottom then the first Data value is returned. If radius is greater than radiusTop then the last Data value is returned.
      Parameters:
      interpType - either InterolatorType.LINEAR or InterpolatorType.CUBIC_SPLINE.
      attributeIndex - the index of the attribute whose value is to be computed
      radius - the radius of the interpolation point, in km.
      Returns:
      interpolated value.

    • getValue

      public double getValue​(HashMapIntegerDouble coefficients, int attribute)
      Retrieve the value of the specified attribute computed using the specified node indexes and interpolation coefficients.
      Parameters:
      coefficients - map from nodeIndex to interpolationCoefficient.
      attribute - attribute index.
      Returns:
      the value of the specified attribute computed using the specified node indexes and interpolation coefficients.

    • getRadius

      public abstract double getRadius​(int i)
      Get the i'th radius value in this profile in km. Radii are in order of increasing radius.

      Behavior when i is out-of-bounds:

      • ProfileEmpty - i == 0 ? radii[0] : radii[1]
      • ProfileThin - always returns radii[0]
      • ProfileConstant - i == 0 ? radii[0] : radii[1]
      • ProfileNPoint - throws IndexOutOfBoundsException if i is out of range
      • ProfileSurface - always return Double.NaN
      Parameters:
      i -
      Returns:
      the i'th radius value in this profile in km.

    • setRadius

      public abstract void setRadius​(int i, float d)

    • getData

      public abstract Data[] getData()
      Retrieve a shallow copy of the array of Data objects associated with this profile. The number of elements depends on ProfileType:
      • EMPTY -- 0
      • THIN -- 1
      • CONSTANT -- 1
      • NPOINT -- N
      • SURFACE -- 1
      • SURFACE_EMPTY -- 0
      Returns:
      Data[]

    • getData

      public abstract Data getData​(int i)
      Retrieve a reference the i'th Data object.
      • ProfileEmpty - returns null
      • ProfileThin - i is ignored. Always returns Data[0]
      • ProfileConstant - i is ignored. Always returns Data[0]
      • ProfileNPoint - throws IndexOutOfBoundsException if i is out of range
      • ProfileSurface - i is ignored. Always returns Data[0]
      • ProfileSurfaceEmpty - returns null
      Parameters:
      i -
      Returns:
      Data

    • getRadii

      public abstract float[] getRadii()
      Get the radii values in km. For ProfileNPoint object, returns a reference to the profiles radii array. The other profile classes return a new float[] that contains the available radius values. ProfileSurface returns new float[0].
      Returns:
      the radii values in km.

    • getRadiusIndex

      public int getRadiusIndex​(double radius)
      Find index i such that x is >= xx[i] and < xx[i+1]. If x < xx[0] returns -1. If x == xx[xx.length-1] return xx.length-2 If x > xx[xx.length-1] return xx.length-1

      This method is translation from Numerical Recipes in C++.

      Parameters:
      radius -
      Returns:
      index i such that radius is >= radii[i] and < radii[i+1].

    • setInterpolationCoefficients

    • findClosestRadiusIndex

      Returns:
      node index of closest radius

    • setPointIndex

      public abstract void setPointIndex​(int nodeIndex, int pointIndex)
      Set the pointIndex that corresponds to the supplied nodeIndex.

      There is a node index for each Data object in a profile and they are indexed from 0 to the number of Data objects managed by a Profile. There is a pointIndex for every Data object in the entire model, indexed from 0 to the number of Data objects in the model.

      Parameters:
      nodeIndex -
      pointIndex -

    • getPointIndex

      public abstract int getPointIndex​(int nodeIndex)
      Get the pointIndex that corresponds to the supplied nodeIndex.

      There is a node index for each Data object in a profile and they are indexed from 0 to the number of Data objects managed by a Profile. There is a pointIndex for every Data object in the entire model, indexed from 0 to the number of Data objects in the model.

      Parameters:
      nodeIndex -
      Returns:
      poitnIndex

    • getPointIndices

      public void getPointIndices​(float radius, HashSet<Integer> points)
      Find the point indeces of the nodes above and below the specified radius and add them to the supplied list of points. Point index values of -1 are not added to the set. The set is not cleared before addition.
      Parameters:
      radius -
      points -

    • integrate

      public double integrate​(int attributeIndex, boolean reciprocal)
      Performs Trapezoidal integration of the requested attribute, or it's reciprocal over the depth of the profile. The result is returned on exit. Zero is returned for profiles with no thickness. This method is overridden for profiles with defined depth.
      Parameters:
      attributeIndex - The index of the attribute whose integral is returned.
      reciprocal - If true the reciprocal attribute is integrated over the profile depth.
      Returns:
      the integration result.

    • computeGradients

      protected void computeGradients​(GeoTessModel model, int attributeIndex, double[] vertexUnitVector, int layerId, boolean reciprocal) throws GeoTessException
      Synchronized method to compute the gradients if needed. Does nothing if gradients are already computed, or if gradients are undefined for the profile type (the implementation below).
      Parameters:
      model - GeoTessModel for which gradients are evaluated.
      attributeIndex - The attribute for which gradients are calculated.
      vertexUnitVector -
      layerId -
      reciprocal - A boolean flag, that if true, stores the calculates gradient.
      Throws:
      GeoTessException

    • gradientString

      protected String gradientString​(double[] g, boolean reciprocal)
      Writes a formated gradient string. Used by Profile toString() methods that define gradients.
      Parameters:
      g - The gradient to returned as a formatted string.
      reciprocal - If true the reciprocal attribute gradient is output and the identifier "(Inv)" is added to the output string.
      Returns:
      The formatted gradient string.

    • vectorString

      protected String vectorString​(double[] v)
      Returns the input vector as a formatted string of the form "[v[0] v[1] v[2]". Used by Profile toString() methods that define gradients or layer normals.
      Parameters:
      v - The vector to be formatted as astring.
      Returns:
      The formatted vector.
